measured_by: 3-item 7-point Likert fear scale (fearful, worried, anxious items)
justification: “Participants indicated on a 7-point Likert scale…the extent to which they felt fearful, worried, anxious…We averaged the first three items into a fear scale.”

measured_by: 3-item 7-point Likert anger scale (angry, outraged, irritated items)
justification: “Participants indicated on a 7-point Likert scale…the extent to which they felt…angry, outraged, and irritated…We averaged…the last three into an anger scale.”
“Participants responded to the item ‘How far did you feel from the event you wrote about?’ on a 7-point Likert scale (1 = very near, 7 = very distant).”

measured_by: certainty items based on Lerner & Keltner (2001)
justification: “In both experiments, we measured appraisals of certainty and control based on Lerner and Keltner (2001)…the anger group reported significantly greater…certainty than the fear group.”

measured_by: control items based on Lerner & Keltner (2001)
justification: “In both experiments, we measured appraisals of certainty and control based on Lerner and Keltner (2001)…the anger group reported significantly greater perceived personal control…”
“In Experiment 2, we also recorded participants' skin conductance response as an additional manipulation check…Self-distancing significantly reduced physiological arousal.”
